policyDescription: Protects and minimizes exposure of personally identifiable information when accessed or shared; enforces masking, logging and role-based access.

protectedFields.reason: Uniquely identifies individuals; high re-identification and fraud risk; subject to strict regulatory controls.
Payment credential; high fraud and financial risk; PCI scope when stored or processed.
Direct contact identifier that enables re-identification and social engineering; limited exposure reduces risk.

view.notes: Only for authorized roles (Data Steward, Admin) with MFA and business need-to-know; full view logged.

mask.notes: Masking or tokenization required before any sharing outside owner/team; default for UI exports.

share.notes: Only with masking, approved purpose, and DUA (Data Use Agreement); must be logged and time-limited.

download.notes: Downloads of raw PII prohibited except via documented exceptions (see Conditions/Exceptions).

edit.notes: Only by Data Owners and authorized admins via audited workflows and change-control.

delete.notes: Allowed under retention/erasure requests following verification and documented approval steps.

conditionsExceptions.details: Full view allowed only for Data Stewards, Privacy Officers, and Admins with MFA and explicit business justification.
If data contains SSN or payment data, automatic masking/tokenization applied for all non-owner roles.
Legal or Incident Response may request unmasked access via documented approval (ticket + manager sign-off); access scoped and time-limited.
Analytics may receive de-identified/aggregated datasets only; project owner must attest to sufficient de-identification.

enforcementActions: Enforce RBAC and attribute-based access controls (ABAC) at API and UI layers.
Apply automated masking/tokenization pipelines before data export or sharing.
Record and retain access logs: who, when, purpose, and dataset snapshot.
Quarterly audits of access; anomalous access triggers investigation and temporary revocation.
Violations: immediate access revocation, incident investigation, and disciplinary action per company policy.
complianceNotes: Handle SSN/Credit Card data in accordance with GDPR/CCPA/PCI-DSS/other applicable laws.
Encrypt data at rest and in transit; use tokenization for payment data where possible.
Retention and deletion follow the Data Retention Schedule; honor verified erasure requests.

policyDescription: Controls access and sharing of financial records to preserve confidentiality, integrity, and auditability of account and transaction data.

protectedFields.reason: Direct financial metric that could be misused for fraud or insider trading; sensitive commercial information.
Contains chronological financial activity tied to accounts; can reveal sensitive business/individual behavior.

view.notes: Allowed for Finance, Account Owners, and authorized Auditors with MFA and least-privilege; actions logged.

mask.notes: Mask or aggregate values for downstream consumers; dollar amounts may be rounded/obfuscated unless justified.

share.notes: Only to authorized internal teams or external parties under DUA and with redaction/masking as required.

download.notes: Raw downloads restricted; allowed under approved data export workflows with cryptographic protections and approval.

edit.notes: Edits permitted only via controlled financial systems and change-control processes; all changes auditable.

delete.notes: Deletion allowed only per retention schedule and with multi-party approval (Finance + Legal).

conditionsExceptions.details: Full access for Finance, Account Owners, and Audit roles; temporary elevated access requires approval and is time-limited.
High-sensitivity transactions (e.g., payment disputes) require redaction for non-authorized roles.
Analytics receive anonymized or aggregated data; raw transaction-level exports require Data Owner signoff and DUA.

enforcementActions: RBAC enforcement integrated with IAM and SSO; periodic entitlement reviews.
Automated alerts for anomalous exports or large-scale data access.
Mandatory logging and immutable audit trails for financial data access and edits.
Access violations trigger immediate suspension, forensic review, and potential regulatory notification.
complianceNotes: Comply with SOX, GLBA, PCI-DSS (if payments present), and other applicable financial regulations.
Maintain segregation of duties for financial transactions and change approvals.
Retain financial records per legal and regulatory retention schedules.

policyDescription: Restricts third-party vendor access to only operational data necessary for contracted services, enforces strict isolation and monitoring.

protectedFields.reason: May contain customer data and business-sensitive information; exposure can reveal operations and customer behavior.
Commercially sensitive; unauthorized disclosure can harm negotiations and competitive position.

view.notes: Limited to specific operational datasets required for vendor tasks; principle of least privilege applies.

mask.notes: PII within order details must be masked before vendor access unless contractually required and approved.

share.notes: External sharing by vendor prohibited unless explicitly allowed by contract and approved by Data Owner.

download.notes: Bulk downloads prohibited; limited exports require approval and are delivered via secure channels.

edit.notes: Editing restricted; where edits are needed, use scoped APIs or supervised interfaces with auditing.

delete.notes: Deletion by vendors is prohibited; data lifecycle actions must be performed by internal Data Owners.

conditionsExceptions.details: Vendor access conditioned on signed DPA/DUA, minimum-security requirements, and background checks as applicable.
Access is time-limited and reviewed monthly; emergency access requires manager + security approval and is audited.
All vendor activity subject to session recording, monitoring, and periodic access reviews.

enforcementActions: Provision vendor accounts on isolated tenants with separate credentials and MFA.
Session monitoring and logging for all vendor interactions; periodic third-party audits.
Immediate revocation of access on contract termination or on detection of policy violations.
Contractual remedies and potential financial penalties for breaches per vendor agreement.
complianceNotes: Require Data Processing Agreements (DPA) and security attestations from all vendors accessing sensitive data.
Align vendor controls with SOC 2 and internal third-party risk management requirements.
Perform annual risk assessments and continuous monitoring of vendor access.
